file_content.text: [The bomb is armed with redundant triggering mechanisms. Disabling any one trigger could cause another to detonate the explosives.]
[Inspect the bomb]
[The bomb is connected to three triggers: a weight sensor on the Senator's chair, an antenna, and a heated gas switch. Any of the triggers can detonate the bomb.]
[Inspect the weight sensor]
[This sensor monitors the Senator's weight in the chair. If he leaves, the bomb will detonate.]
[The weight sensor is connected to the heated gas switch and an antenna. Disconnecting it will detonate the bomb if the other triggers are still active.]
[Inspect the antenna]
[The antenna remotely detonates the bomb if it receives a signal from Wraith, or if any of the other trigger mechanisms are disabled.]
[An attached power supply keeps the antenna active, and also sends power to the heated gas switch. Strangely, it has a simple on-off switch.]
[Inspect the gas switch]
[This heated gas switch detonates the bomb if its internal pressure isn't maintained.]
[Wires connect this trigger to the weight sensor and the antenna's power supply, creating a circuit that heats the gas and maintains the pressure.]
[Interrupting any part of the circuit will make it impossible for the gas to resist the exterior air pressure, causing detonation.]
[Inspect the other triggers]
[Inspect the area]
[The area is filled with weapons and various chemicals. A series of large ventilation ducts are also visible throughout the room.]
[Apparently, the chamber is equipped with an emergency atmosphere cycling system. You may be able to use that system to briefly create a vacuum inside the chamber.]
[Inspect the area again]
[More Options]
[The bomb wiring appears to be partially exposed on the control panel...]
[Inspect the control panel]
[The explosive appears to be armed with multiple sensors.]
[Inspect the bomb]
[Inspect the bomb]
[Wires connect the chair to a small gray box and an antenna which then connect to a small green cylinder]
[Inspect the small gray box]
[Inspect the small gray box]
[The small box appears to be a pressure monitor]
[It is connected to the chair and to the green cylinder]
[It is also connected to the antenna control box]
[Disarming this first may alert a remote sensor to detonate]
[Inspect the green cylinder]
[Inspect the green cylinder]
[The pliable green cylinder houses a heated gas suspending a mercury switch]
[Wires connect the device to a small gray box, the primary detonator and the antenna]
[The wires create a circuit, providing energy to a heating element]
[Interrupting the circuit will make it impossible for the gas to resist the exterior pressure, causing detonation...]
[It appears there is no direct way you can interact with this object safely]
[Inspect the antenna]
[Inspect the antenna]
[The antenna is connected to a small box on the floor by two wires]
[The box appears to be a power supply and a remote relay kit]
[Any attempt to disarm the bomb may trigger a remote detonation unless this is disabled]
[Closer inspection reveals possible tamper protection mechanisms]
[Strangely amidst the security you discover a simple off switch to disable the battery, apparently unprotected]
[Inspect the area]
[Inspect the area]
[The area is filled with weapons and various chemicals]
[A series of large ventilation ducts are visible throughout the room]
[It appears this chamber is equipped with an emergency atmosphere evacuation system]
[If necessary you may be able to create a vacuum within the chamber]
[Exit]
[Exit]
[The bomb is armed with redundant triggering mechanisms, including a weight sensor on the Senator's chair, an antenna for remote detonation, and a heated gas switch.]
[Inspect the bomb]
[Inspect the gas switch]
[Any of the triggers can detonate the bomb, and they all seem resistant to tampering.]
[Inspect the area]
[However, if the room's atmospheric controls could be used to create a temporary vaccuum, the gas switch might fail without causing detonation.]
[The exposed wiring connects to the failsafe switches.]
[It may be possible to shoot the bomb and cause a partial, potentially non-fatal explosion.]
[Mark the control panel for attack?]
[Mark the control panel for attack]
[You will now shoot the control panel when interacting with it.]
[You can still inspect the bomb by inspecting the gas switch.]
[Return to other options]
[Exit]
[Return to previous]
[Exit]
[Remove the mark for attack from the bomb control panel?]
[Yes.]
[No.]
[The bomb appears to be a complex mechanism but with a key vulnerability.]
[The wiring directly behind the Senator is exposed. By blasting the control panel you could interrupt the primary detonation.]
[Although the Senator will be injured by the smaller explosion, improperly disarming the bomb may kill both of you.]
[Mark the control panel for attack]
[You will now shoot the control panel when interacting with it.]
[You can still inspect the bomb by inspecting the gas switch.]
[Attempt to disarm the bomb.]
[The bomb is armed with redundant triggering mechanisms. Disabling any one trigger could cause another to detonate the explosives.]
[Inspect the bomb]
[The bomb is connected to three triggers: a weight sensor on the Senator's chair, an antenna, and a heated gas switch. Any of the triggers can detonate the bomb.]
[Inspect the weight sensor]
[This sensor monitors the Senator's weight in the chair. If he leaves, the bomb will detonate.]
[The weight sensor is connected to the heated gas switch and an antenna. Disconnecting it will detonate the bomb if the other triggers are still active.]
[Inspect the antenna]
[The antenna remotely detonates the bomb if it receives a signal from Wraith, or if any of the other trigger mechanisms are disabled.]
[An attached power supply keeps the antenna active, and also sends power to the heated gas switch. Strangely, it has a simple on-off switch.]
[Inspect the gas switch]
[This heated gas switch detonates the bomb if its internal pressure isn't maintained.]
[Wires connect this trigger to the weight sensor and the antenna's power supply, creating a circuit that heats the gas and maintains the pressure.]
[Interrupting any part of the circuit will make it impossible for the gas to resist the exterior air pressure, causing detonation.]
[Inspect the area]
[The area is filled with weapons and various chemicals. A series of large ventilation ducts are also visible throughout the room.]
[Apparently, the chamber is equipped with an emergency atmosphere cycling system. You may be able to use that system to briefly create a vacuum inside the chamber.]
